005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.object;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.AbstractCustomJavaDataType;
009
010import java.time.temporal.Temporal;
011
012import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
013
014/**
015 * Implementations of this class represent a temporal value which may not have a
016 * timezone making it ambiguous as a point/window in time.
017 * <p>
018 * Metaschema has a need to represent dates and times that allow for an
019 * ambiguous time zone. This is due to some models not requiring a time zone as
020 * part of a date/time. An ambiguous dateTime allows a time zone to be inferred,
021 * without change information in the source content.
022 * <p>
023 * This class wraps a ZonedDateTime object and tracks if a time zone was found
024 * when parsing, which can be used to ensure that the assumed time zone is not
025 * written back out in such cases.
026 *
027 * @param <TYPE>
028 *          the bound object type that extends this class, used for proper type
029 *          inheritance in implementing classes like {@code AmbiguousDate} or
030 *          {@code AmbiguousDateTime}
031 * @param <U>
032 *          the Java type of the temporal value
033 */
034public abstract class AbstractAmbiguousTemporal<TYPE extends AbstractAmbiguousTemporal<TYPE, U>, U extends Temporal>
035    extends AbstractCustomJavaDataType<TYPE, U> {
036  private final boolean timeZone;
037
038  /**
039   * Construct a new object. This type supports ambiguous dates/times that were
040   * provided without a time zone.
041   *
042   * @param value
043   *          the date value
044   * @param hasTimeZone
045   *          {@code true} if the date is intended to have an associated time zone
046   *          or {@code false} otherwise
047   */
048  public AbstractAmbiguousTemporal(@NonNull U value, boolean hasTimeZone) {
049    super(value);
050    this.timeZone = hasTimeZone;
051  }
052
053  /**
054   * Indicate if a time zone is configured.
055   *
056   * @return {@code true} if the date is intended to have an associated time zone
057   *         or {@code false} otherwise
058   */
059  public boolean hasTimeZone() {
060    return timeZone;
061  }
062
063  @Override
064  public String toString() {
065    return getValue().toString() + (hasTimeZone() ? "" : "(abiguous)");
066  }
067
068}
